tidyfft 0.0.0.9000

Filter for Maximum Magnitude in a tidy_fft Object

Source: R/cross.R
filter_max_mod.Rd

This function filters a tidy_fft object to find the frequency with the maximum magnitude (mod), while respecting the dimensional and complex/real-valued structure.

Usage

filter_max_mod(a)

Arguments

a

A tidy_fft object containing FFT results.

Value

A tibble containing a single row corresponding to the frequency with the maximum magnitude.

Details

The function first converts the input to the polar representation ("polr") using change_repr(), then filters out rows where all frequency dimensions (dim_*) are zero (for complex-valued input) or less than or equal to zero (for real-valued input).

See also

cross_spec() for computing the cross-spectrum.

Examples

# Generate a tidy_fft object
a <- tidy_fft(c(1, 0, -1, 0))

# Compute cross-spectrum (self-correlation for simplicity)
cross_result <- cross_spec(a, a)

# Filter for maximum magnitude
max_mod_result <- filter_max_mod(cross_result)
print(max_mod_result)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 3
#>   dim_1   mod   arg
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1  0.25     4     0
